content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Structure Overview
The target image shows a complex building block structure with two main sections:
- A left tower with a tall cylindrical column topped by a triangular roof
- A right section with multiple components including columns, platforms, and arched elements

## Block Count and Layers
Total blocks used: approximately 16-17 blocks
The structure has multiple layers, with the tallest part reaching about 5 layers high

## Spatial Relationships
- Left section: Features a tall orange cylinder with another cylinder below it, topped with an orange triangular roof. A yellow rectangular platform supports a red arched block with a yellow half-cylinder piece.
- Right section: Has two orange cylindrical pillars supporting yellow rectangular platforms. The bottom has a red block with a circular opening, supported by a yellow base.
- Both sections use similar components but in different arrangements.

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on my analysis, the following blocks are needed:

- Block #1: Red arch/tunnel blocks (2 units)
- Block #3: Yellow horizontal rectangular blocks (3 units) 
- Block #4: Yellow horizontal rectangular blocks (1 unit)
- Block #5: Orange vertical cylinders (5 units)
- Block #7: Yellow half-cylinder (1 unit)
- Block #13: Orange triangular roof piece (3 units)

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 3
    Step2: Move block with index 5
    Step3: Move block with index 5
    Step4: Move block with index 3
    Step5: Move block with index 1
    Step6: Move block with index 7
    Step7: Move block with index 5
    Step8: Move block with index 13
    Step9: Move block with index 3
    Step10: Move block with index 5
    Step11: Move block with index 5
    Step12: Move block with index 4
    Step13: Move block with index 13
    Step14: Move block with index 1
    Step15: Move block with index 3
    Step16: Move block with index 13
}
```

This assembly order builds the structure from the bottom up, starting with the left section's base and working through to the right section, ensuring stability throughout the construction process.
